text: “Alaric stands with Attila among Rome’s best-known antagonists,” Cullen Murphy writes, “but the source material is gossamer-thin.” https://t.co/zYUZMivUnk

text: Listen to @alexismadrigal update @jameshamblin and @katlwells on the coronavirus numbers — and why the spread of the pandemic seems so random: https://t.co/5rFuacTYFy

name: TheAtlantic
text: From open-air cafés to drive-in theaters at airports, how might the pandemic transform cities? @YasmeenSerhan considers the possibilities: https://t.co/V7L2TVBYjs

name: TheAtlantic
text: Films like "Do the Right Thing" and "The Spook Who Sat by the Door" frame urban uprisings as just actions against brutality and as catalysts for change. @samshepPhD on movies about American protest: https://t.co/sCBRoBFSuR
